title: Facts about the coronavirus and COVID-19
description: Get the facts about COVID-19 from Kaiser Permanente. We'll update this page regularly to keep you and your family informed, supported, and safe.

But some people have an increased risk of developing severe symptoms from COVID-19 and may need to take extra precautions to avoid infection.] You may be at high risk if you: - Are 65 or older - Live in a long-term care facility - Have an ongoing serious health condition, such as: - Lung disease or asthma - Heart conditions - High blood pressure [Severe obesity](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/health-wellness/health-encyclopedia/he.center1038) - Diabetes - Kidney or liver disease - A weakened [immune system](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/health-wellness/health-encyclopedia/he.learning-about-your-immune-system.abl2845) - Cancer treatment - Smoke or vape [tobacco/nicotine](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/health-wellness/health-encyclopedia/he.quitting-smoking.center1045)or marijuana (Kaiser Permanente members have many ways to get help quitting, including in-person appointments with a therapist or doctor, [personalized online plans](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/health-wellness/healthy-lifestyle-programs), and [Wellness Coaching by Phone](/health-wellness/wellness-coaching)) - Are pregnant (If you're pregnant, learn more about how the virus could affect you or your care at the [COVID-19 maternity page](https://healthy.kaiserpermanente.org/health-wellness/maternity/healthy/covid-19-and-pregnancy)) [Visit CDC.gov](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/index.html) for a full list of people at high risk for severe illness from COVID-19.
